com.phunware.engagement.internal.database

Interface SQLiteDatabaseHelper

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AnalyticsDatabaseHelper, LocationDatabaseHelper, MessageDatabaseHelper, SecurePreferences

    public SQLiteDatabaseHelper

    A helper class to manage table creation and versioning.

    Each module of the SDK should implement it's own helper to manage tables in it's domain. When the helper is registered with the SQLiteDatabaseManager, it's SQLiteDatabaseHelper.onCreate or SQLiteDatabaseHelper.onUpgrade method will be called, as needed.

    A simple implementation might look like this: 

     public class FooDatabaseHelper implements DatabaseHelper { private static final String TABLE_NAME = "foos"; private static final int VERSION = 2; private final DatabaseManager mDbManager; public FooDatabaseHelper(DatabaseManager dbManager) { mDbManager = dbManager; mDbManager.addDatabaseHelper(this); } @Override @NonNull String getName() { return TABLE_NAME; } @Override int getVersion() { return VERSION; } @Override public void onCreate(SQLiteDatabase db) { db.exec("CREATE TABLE Foos(_ID INTEGER AUTOINCREMENT PRIMARY KEY, Content TEXT);"); } @Override public void onUpgrade(SQLiteDatabase db, int fromVersion, int toVersion) { int version = fromVersion; switch (version) { case 1: db.exec("ALTER TABLE Foos ADD COLUMN(IsRead INTEGER default 0);"); version++; } if (version != toVersion) { // Something went wrong with the upgrade, so drop and recreate. db.exec("DROP TABLE Foos;"); onCreate(db); } } public Foo getFooById(long id) { SQLiteDatabase db = mDbManager.getReadableDatabase(); Cursor c = db.query(...); return convertToFoo(c); } }

    See Also:
    SQLiteDatabaseHelper.onCreate, SQLiteDatabaseHelper.onUpgrade

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getName()
      The unique name of the module that this helper represents. The name is not user visible, but is used to track version information so the SQLiteDatabaseManager can manage creation and updating of tables.
      int getVersion()
      Version number of the database. If this version is newer than the last installed version, SQLiteDatabaseHelper.onUpgrade will be called.
      void onCreate()
      Called when this SQLiteDatabaseHelper is added to the database for the first time. This is where the creation and initial population of tables should be performed.
      void onUpgrade()
      Called when the tables in this SQLiteDatabaseHelper need to be upgraded. The implementation should use this method to add, drop or modify tables as needed.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()

        The unique name of the module that this helper represents. The name is not user visible, but is used to track version information so the SQLiteDatabaseManager can manage creation and updating of tables.

        Returns:
        The unique name of the helper (e.g. "com.phunware.engagement.sqlitedatabasehelper")

      • getVersion

        int getVersion()

        Version number of the database. If this version is newer than the last installed version, SQLiteDatabaseHelper.onUpgrade will be called.

        Returns:
        The current version of the helper.
        See Also:
        SQLiteDatabaseHelper.onUpgrade

      • onCreate

        void onCreate()

        Called when this SQLiteDatabaseHelper is added to the database for the first time. This is where the creation and initial population of tables should be performed.

      • onUpgrade

        void onUpgrade()

        Called when the tables in this SQLiteDatabaseHelper need to be upgraded. The implementation should use this method to add, drop or modify tables as needed.
